The Southern field has been presented to me as a difficult field to work, because of the white people who have the slave master's spirit with the slave master's cruelty in exercising the same, as if the blacks were no more than beasts; and to be treated worse than the dumb animals because they are in the 


                                    -12- 

form of man, having the marks of the black--Negro-race.--Letter 223, 1899, p. 1. (To J. E. White and wife, June 22, 1899.)
